bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: wounds and injuries of the lower extremities
flesh wounds of the lower extremities
suppuration and necrosis of tibia-tarsal articulation
circular amputation in lower third of leg

revisionDesc.change: additional proofing of transcription and encoding, edited and added keyword terms

Sarah Synovec initial checking of OCR text; encoded P5 Encoding

body.p: CASE 10.—Private M. Dunham, Co. D, Engineer Battalion, aged 23 years, received a severe incised wound of the left ankle January 24, 1864. He was sent to hospital at Alexandria. Surgeon E. Bentley, U. S. V., reports that long-continued suppuration had ended in necrosis of the tibia-tarsal articulation, the patient being of a strumous habit. Dr. Bentley practised a circular amputation in the lower third of the leg May 5, 1864. Pyæmia supervened, and death ensued June 18, 1864.
